A: 1. A shock baton is also called a stun _? (a) gun (b) stick (c) rod
2. Shock batons are equipped with electrical _? (a) current (b) wires (c) power
3. Police use shock batons to overpower _? (a) animals (b) criminals (c) cars
4. Shock batons are designed to _ criminals without killing them? (a) disable (b) hurt (c) scare
5. Satellite communication helps exchange information from any point of the world to _? (a) another (b) space (c) a city
6. Satellite technology helps in finding and rescuing victims during _? (a) parties (b) accidents (c) holidays
7. Security agencies use satellite communication to find the location of _? (a) friends (b) criminals (c) birds
8. The Nigerian Police Force maintains public order, law, and _? (a) safety (b) money (c) food
9. The police _ and prosecutes people involved in criminal activities? (a) helps (b) arrests (c) watches
10. The police detects and _ criminal activities? (a) hides (b) investigates (c) forgets
11. The military is made up of the army, navy, and _? (a) police (b) air force (c) SSS
12. The army fights on _? (a) water (b) land (c) air
13. The navy fights on _? (a) land (b) water (c) air
14. The air force fights in the _? (a) water (b) land (c) air
15. The military protects the territorial _ of Nigeria? (a) size (b) integrity (c) people
16. The military defends Nigeria against internal and external _? (a) friends (b) aggression (c) games
17. SSS is also known as _? (a) DSS (b) NSS (c) CSS
18. The DSS protects Nigeria against _ to peace and security? (a) gifts (b) threats (c) songs
19. DSS personnel provide security to government _? (a) animals (b) officials (c) buildings
20. DSS investigates events likely to cause a breach of _ in Nigeria? (a) peace (b) security (c) fun
21. Drones are used for aerial _? (a) swimming (b) surveillance (c) cooking
22. Drones help security agents get useful information for crime _? (a) detection (b) hiding (c) making
23. CCTV helps investigations to detect _? (a) crimes (b) movies (c) weather
24. CCTV helps to obtain _ for prosecution of suspected criminals? (a) food (b) evidence (c) toys
25. The NSCDC was founded in _? (a) 1967 (b) 1993 (c) 1891
26. NSCDC helps promote peace and _? (a) war (b) order (c) noise
27. NSCDC helps rescue Nigerians in case of natural _? (a) parties (b) disasters (c) holidays
28. NSCDC provides security during _? (a) elections (b) sleep (c) eating
29. NSCDC monitors private guards and security _? (a) cars (b) companies (c) dogs
30. NSCDC protects national assets like petroleum _? (a) pipes (b) cars (c) houses
31. The Nigerian Customs Service was formed in _? (a) 1967 (b) 1891 (c) 1993
32. Customs service collects _ like import duties? (a) toys (b) revenues (c) clothes
33. Customs service tackles _? (a) singing (b) smuggling (c) dancing
34. Customs service checks for dangerous _ smuggling? (a) food (b) arms (c) books
35. The Nigerian Immigration Service was officially formed on August 1, _? (a) 1958 (b) 1963 (c) 1993
36. Immigration service provides international _ for Nigerian citizens? (a) cars (b) passports (c) phones
37. Immigration service monitors _ into the country? (a) birds (b) immigration (c) fish
38. NAFDAC was founded in _? (a) 1967 (b) 1891 (c) 1993
39. NAFDAC tackles fake and _ food and drugs? (a) real (b) counterfeit (c) new
40. NAFDAC regulates the manufacture and _ of food and drugs? (a) eating (b) import (c) playing
41. NAFDAC arrests manufacturers of counterfeit food and drugs with the help of the _? (a) military (b) police (c) SSS
42. NAFDAC confiscates and destroys _ food and drugs? (a) new (b) expired (c) fresh
43. NAFDAC locks up offices where counterfeit food and drugs are _? (a) sold (b) produced (c) eaten
44. If you have 5 security cameras and add 3 more, how many cameras do you have in total? (a) 7 (b) 8 (c) 9
45. A security guard works 6 hours a day. How many hours does he work in 2 days? (a) 8 (b) 10 (c) 12
46. If a police car drives 10 kilometers and then 5 more, how many kilometers did it drive in total? (a) 15 (b) 5 (c) 20
47. A security team has 7 members. If 3 members go on patrol, how many members are left? (a) 3 (b) 4 (c) 5
48. A drone can fly for 20 minutes. If it has flown for 10 minutes, how many more minutes can it fly? (a) 5 (b) 10 (c) 15
49. If 9 security lights are needed and 3 are already installed, how many more lights are needed? (a) 5 (b) 6 (c) 7
50. A security agency has 12 vehicles. If 4 vehicles are used for patrols, how many vehicles are not on patrol? (a) 6 (b) 7 (c) 8
B: 1. What is another name for a shock baton? _________
2. Which agency is the main one for maintaining law and order in Nigeria? _________
3. What are the three branches of the Nigerian military? _________
4. When was the Nigerian Customs Service formed? _________
C: 1. Name two uses of satellite communication.
2. List two functions of the Nigerian Police.
3. State two functions of the State Security Service (DSS).
4. Mention two uses of drones in security.
5. What are two functions of NAFDAC?
answers_B: National Agency for Food and Drug Administration and Control
answers_C: Exchange information globally, help in finding and rescuing victims during emergencies.
Maintains public order, arrests and prosecutes criminals.
Protect Nigeria against threats, provide security to government officials.
Aerial surveillance, attacks against criminal elements.
Regulates food and drugs, arrests manufacturers of counterfeit products.
